# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    output_string = words[1]
    curr_width = length(words[1])
    for word in words[2:end]
        if curr_width + length(word) > text_width
            output_string *= "\n" * word
            curr_width = length(word)
        else
            output_string *= " " * word
            curr_width += 1 + length(word)
        end
    end
    return output_string
end
```

Example:
```julia
input_string = "This is a test string for wrapping"
wrap_string(input_string, 10)
```
```
"This is a\ntest\nstring for\nwrapping"
```
